intro: Rourea prancei, commonly known as the Prance's rourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
